Description: Upper body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior glazed black; exterior: reserved handle zone; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies this sherd as possibly coming from a Type 9 South Ionian cup with everted rim. The lack of a rim prevents any more precise identification. Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus, the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18).
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 54, no. 20)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.259) (Phase 3)
